name: Attenuverter
description: This simple algorithm scales and offsets signals using the formula output = offset + (input × scale). It is probably most useful for CVs but can also be applied to audio. The signal is scaled first, then an offset voltage is added. Various offset parameters are provided, which might be useful in different scenarios—they are all simply summed together. Note that it is valid to use this algorithm with no input bus selected; in such cases, the output is just the offset voltage.
use_cases: Scaling CV signals for modular synthesis
Adjusting audio signal levels in a mixing environment
Creating voltage offsets without input modulation
Fine-tuning control voltages for sequencers or LFOs
